attributes.action: stop publicly funded banks from instigating foreclosure proceedings or charging banking fees to customers until such time as the bank is no longer funded by public money
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Despite the recent bailing out of major banking organisations at the taxpayer's expense, banks who are now owned in part by the public are continuing to charge exorbitant fees when customer goes over their limit and are still forcing people out of their homes for defaulting on their mortgages.  This is clearly unacceptable for a publicly funded organisation and is tantamount to the public paying to be charged fees or being made homeless.  Stop this now and send a strong message to the banks that their practises are both unethical and intolerable.

rejection.details: Your petition addresses two issues, one of which already has a petition, see http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/BankCharge1/ Please resubmit as a single issue. Thank you.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
